newsitem.title: ITALY: Blair win opens new era in Europe - Italy's D'Alema.
newsitem.headline: Blair win opens new era in Europe - Italy's D'Alema.

text.p: The Democratic Party of the Left (PDS), the biggest force in Italy's government, on Friday hailed Tony Blair's British election victory as a new era for Europe.

"The extraordinary victory of New Labour led by you opens a new political phase for Europe," PDS leader Massimo D'Alema said in a letter congratulating Blair on the landslide victory of his Labour party that ended 18 years of Conservative rule.
"The Conservative age has ended. The age of the left, which has had the courage to renew itself and become a credible alternative for government, has begun," D'Alema said.
D'Alema knows the feeling. His party entered government a year ago in an historic victory for the left after it dumped its communist past and relaunched itself as a social democratic force.
The PDS is the backbone of Prime Minister Romano Prodi's centre-left coalition.
D'Alema said Blair's victory in Thursday's general election would reinforce the role of the left in Europe. "The right in Europe loses a stronghold, bringing it closer to its decline," he said.
